lexUnit.name: exclaim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cry out suddenly, especially in surprise, anger, or pain.

sentence.text: ` Sad ? " they both exclaimed together .
` Now that 's what I call a real bird's-eye view ! " she exclaimed as she landed , beaming with delight .
" Oh , but you 've been in bed ! " she exclaimed as soon as she went round the angle .
` Any landing you walk away from is a good one , " she exclaimed as they taxied in to the small terminal .
Staring back at him , aware of how still he was holding himself , she exclaimed weakly , ` Oh , Leo , could does n't even enter into it .
This combination was so successful that one dealer exclaimed indignantly ` These prices are what I would charge myself . "
Barbaric , we might exclaim , how awful !
I exclaimed , bewildered , ` But she must be seventy . "
It 's for me , Thérèse exclaimed : it 's from the nuns in Soeur Dosithée 's old convent .
` Fabia , love , how nice to hear from you ! " her mother exclaimed .
` Why did n't you say so before ? " exclaimed the Bookman .
` What a shame ! " exclaimed Carol .
Phil exclaimed in alarm , ` What 's wrong , Arty , boy ?
“ Feargal ! ” she exclaimed in exasperation .
` Upon my soul , " Louisa exclaimed to Emilia Frere , ` your husband is a man of surprises .
It 's impossible ! she exclaimed to herself , getting up and leaning on the rough stone windowsill .
Javed 's gouging prompted commentator Richie Benaud to exclaim to millions of viewers : ` Steady on there ! "
` If it is three billion guilders up front , it is an incredible deal , " one London-based analyst who declined identification exclaimed to Reuter .
` Goodness , " Robbie exclaimed scornfully .
` Fenmen , disgusting representations of ignorance and indecency ! " exclaimed the judge in the Littleport riots in 1816 .

Tawell , who was deeply affronted that such a respectable businessman should be arrested on such a charge , exclaimed that he had never heard of Sara Hart , nor of Salt Hill , and he had definitely never been there .
` Yea , that is it ! " exclaimed Anne delightedly .
We exclaimed our astonishment and relief , and rushed to embrace him .
` Goodness me , what an escape ! " exclaimed the Brownie Guider .
( " The letter killeth , the spirit giveth life ! " exclaimed the Collector fervently ) .
" I 'll bet you do n't know , Chuck , how Saigon got its name , do you ? " exclaimed Joseph at last , closing the book and jumping to his feet .
Even the much-travelled Portia paused in the ripple of her chatter to exclaim her appreciation .
